headline.main: LATEST FROM HAVANA.; Inopportune Rains--Return of the CaptainGeneral--The Keystone State after theSumter--Affairs in St. Domingo--Newsfrom Venezuela--Terrorism--An Earthquake, &c., &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: My last letter was sent by the steamer Santiago de Cuba, which left this port on the evening of the 14th inst. Considerable anxiety is felt to know of her safe arrival, as some hours after the steamer's departure we had rather boisterous weather, something in the style of a hurricane.

headline.main: From the Ladies' Visitor of this City.; MOTHERS, TIMELY WARNING. A PERFECT CHARM.
Arrival of a British War Steamer.

docs.snippet: Mr. PHINEAS F. FRAZEE, who was arrested in Rahway on Sunday on a charge of treason, was brought before JOHN WHITEHEAD, Esq., United States Commissioner, yesterday morning, for examination, a crowd of spectators being present. United States...

headline.main: NOTES OF THE REBELLION.; TRAITORS IN THE NORTH, TRYING TO RIDE THE FENCE.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. PHINEAS F. FRAZEE, who was arrested in Rahway on Sunday on a charge of treason, was brought before JOHN WHITEHEAD, Esq., United States Commissioner, yesterday morning, for examination, a crowd of spectators being present. United States District-Attorney KEASBEY appeared as prosecutor, and Ex-Governor PENNINGTON as counsel for defendant.

headline.main: FROM GEN, BANKS' COLUMN.; THREATENED ATTACK AT POINT OF ROCKS.

docs.lead_paragraph: Information has reached our encampment that there has been much firing across the river by the rebels at our pickets, at various points between Conrad's and Harper's Ferries, since Saturday last, and it is reported that an attack was threatened on Saturday at the Point of Rocks.

headline.main: GEN. DIX'S COMMAND.; FROM BALTIMORE. THE ZOUAVES FORTIFYING FEDERAL HILL CHEERFUL LABOR THE INDICATIONS OF FUTUREMOVEMENTS. NEWS OF THE REBELLION

docs.lead_paragraph: Ground was broken, yesterday, for the erection of formidable earth-works on Federal Hill, to be named "Fort Duryee," in honor of the Commandant of this post. Lieut.-Col. GOUVERNEUR K. WARREN, of the Fifth Regiment, an experienced officer of engineers, and Capt. PRIME, U. S.A., are superintending the work, and it is proceeding very rapidly. One-third of the Zouaves
